shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 3ra-131rb) I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 3ra-5rb) I-2) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 5va-7vb) I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki... "I worship Thee..." (fols. 7vb-8vb) I-4) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 114 miracles (fols. 9ra-131rb) I-5) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi... "Does not the man..." (distributed among the miracles of Mary, fols. 11ra-38vb), incomplete (32 strophes)
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: According to Additio 2, the Ms. was purchased by Wäldä Yoḥannǝs. His name (and his baptismal name Gäbrä ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer) as well as the names of his family members were added to the supplication formulas by the same hands as Additiones 1 and 2.

dcomments.dcomment: S. Additio 2; the Ms. was purchased during the reign of King Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889-1913) and šum ʾagame Dästa (däǧǧazmač Dästa Sǝbḥat, in office 1902-08). Fols. 133-134 (quire XVII) originate from an older (15th cent.?) Ms.

txstates.txstate: The sewing has been partly repaired (with a synthetic thread through quires A, I and II). Fols. 133 and 134 (miniatures), originating from an older MS., have been inserted into the codex and were loosely attached to the textblock (between endleaves and back board).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover is poorly visible (at least 4 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, cross hatching, double sine wave with dots).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(10/fols. 3r-12v) – II(8/fol. 13r-20v) – III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – V(8/fols. 37r-44v) – VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) – VII(8/fols. 53r-60v) – VIII(8/fols. 61r-68v) – IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – X(8/fols. 77r-84v) – XI(8/fols. 85r-92v) – XII(8/fols. 93r-100v) – XIII(8/fols. 101r-108v) – XVI(8/fols. 109r-116v) – XV(8/fols. 117r-124v) – XVI(8/fols. 125r-132v) – <XVII(2; sl.: 1; 2, no stubs/fols. 133r-134v)>

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling (sometimes below the ruling: e.g., fols. 31v, 44rv, 55v, 66v). The bottom line is written above the ruling (some fols. have an additional bottom line: e.g., fols. 25r-28r, 37v-40r, 41v-45v, 47v-48r, 49v-51r, 80r, 90v, 95v-100v). Some leaves have an additional ruled line in the upper margin: fols. 55r-57r, 59r, 61r, 63rv.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-4; sometimes the first word of Text I-5; incipit of (sub)sections partly section numbers of Text I-4; elements of the punctuation signs and of text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
Text I-2 is followed by the hymns: - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam wäladitä ʾamlak ... "O my Lady Mary, Godbearing ..." (fol. 7ra-7ra l.11) - ʾƎgzǝʾtǝyä ʾǝmmu lä-ʾǝgziʾǝyä kähali ... "My Lady, Mother of my Lord the Almighty ..." (fol. 7ra l.11-rb l.3) (cp. ChRep no. 373) - Sälam läki Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä nädd ... "Salutation to you Mary, Mother of the Saviour, Mother of the Flame ..." (fol. 7rb l.3-7vb).
The miracles of Mary (Text I-4) are numbered, partly in a secondary hand (the same as Additio 1).

additional.cont: Fol. 8vb: Supplication for the donor.
additional.det: The supplication is written in Amharic, in purple pen. The donor's baptismal name, Gäbrä ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer, and names of his family members are included in the note.

The note states that the "book of ʿAddi Qiyahto" was purchased by Wäldä Yoḥannǝs during the time of King Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889-1913) and the governor šum ʾagame Dästa whose baptismal name is Gäbrä Ḥǝywät (in office 1902-08). Wäldä Yoḥannǝs' family members are also mentioned (e.g., father: Wäldä ʾAbbǝyä ʾƎgziʾ, mother: Wälättä Maryam). A similar note is written in purple pen on fol. 2v.

extras.extra: - Space left for the rubricated incipit of the 114th miracle is not filled on fol. 130va. - Omitted words are inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 23rb, 25rb, 67vb, 81rb, 97ra, 112rb. - Erasures: fols. 3vb, 4ra, 5ra, 93va (several lines). - Many corrections and omitted passages are written interlineally or in the margins on fols. 3va-8r, in purple pen. - Mistaken letters are marked in purple pen: e.g., fols. 17va, 18ra, 19vb, 78va, 81vb, 119vb. - Short list of names (rulers and authorities) is crudely written in pencil on fol. 131vb.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts written in purple pen, e.g.: ዘታህሣሥ፡ ደቅስዮስ: fol. 9ra ልደት: fol. 15ra መድኃኒዓለም: fol. 17ra ዘዜና: fol. 35ra የካቲት፡ ክዳናም[sic]: fol. 36ra ዘነሐሴ፡ ፲፮: fol. 38vb ዘአስተርእዮ: fol. 40va ዘሰንየ፡ ቅዳሴቤታ: fol. 42rb ዘልደት: fol. 43va ዘቍስቋም: fol. 43vb ዘአርብ: fol. 44ra ዮሐንስ፡ መጥማቅ: fol. 44va ዘመስከረም፡ ፲ጼዴንያ: fol. 52rb ዘአንቅአ፡ ማየ፡ ሰኔ፰ቀን: fol. 89vb ቍስቋም: fol. 91ra ጥር: fol. 92va ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ሕርያቆስ: fol. 113vb.

miniature.info: Fol. 133v: St. George slaying the dragon.
miniature.details: The miniature can be dated back to the 15th century (?). St. George is depicted with a companion who is carrying a flask.
The miniature can be dated back to the 15th century (?). The iconography of the miniature is related to Fǝre Ṣǝyon (?).

frames.frame: Fol. 3r: (incipit page Text I-1): simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band.
